de.mslab.McOE

Class McOE

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mslab.McOE.McOE
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GenericMcOE, GenericMcOETagSplit, McOEX

    public abstract class McOE
extends java.lang.Object
    McOE abstract Base Class. It defines the structure of all McOE inherited classes and some static tools.
    Author:
    Paul Kramer

      • encryptAuthenticate

        public abstract byte[] encryptAuthenticate(byte[] Header,
                         byte[] Message,
                         int Blocksize,
                         org.bouncycastle.crypto.BlockCipher Cipher,
                         byte[] Key)
        Encrypts a Message using McOE.
        Parameters:
        Header - the Header
        Message - the Message
        Blocksize - block ciphers block size in bits
        Cipher - the current cipher
        Returns:
        the ciphertext

      • decryptAuthenticate

        public abstract byte[] decryptAuthenticate(byte[] Header,
                         byte[] Ciphertext,
                         byte[] Tag,
                         int Blocksize,
                         org.bouncycastle.crypto.BlockCipher Cipher,
                         byte[] Key)
        Decrypts a Message using McOE.
        Parameters:
        Header - the Header
        Ciphertext - the Ciphertext
        Tag - the Tag
        Blocksize - the Blocksize in Bits
        Cipher - the used BlockCipher e.g. AES
        Key - the key as byte array
        Returns:
        the plaintext or null if the tag was not valid

      • getNumberOfBlocks

        public int getNumberOfBlocks(byte[] Message,
                    int Blocksize)
        Returns the number of message blocks.
        Parameters:
        Message - the message
        Blocksize - the current block size of the cipher in bit
        Returns:
        the number of blocks

      • XOR

        public byte[] XOR(byte[] Left,
         int LeftOffset,
         byte[] Right,
         int RightOffset,
         int BytesToHandle)
        XOR - xor's the input arrays bytewise and returns the result, both input arrays should have BytesToHandle bytes till the end
        Parameters:
        Left - input array
        LeftOffset - the beginning offset of the left array
        Right - input array
        RightOffset - the beginning offset of the right array
        BytesToHandle -
        Returns:
        left xor right

      • byteToLongArray

        public long[] byteToLongArray(byte[] Input)
        Converts byte array to long array
        Parameters:
        Input - the input as byte array
        Returns:
        an array of long values containing the given byte array. If the bytearray was shorter than a mulitple of longs datatypoe length, the length will be filled to a multiple number of long type.

      • equalsBlock

        public boolean equalsBlock(byte[] Left,
                  int LeftOffset,
                  byte[] Right,
                  int RightOffset,
                  int BytesToHandle)
        Determines if two blocks are equal
        Parameters:
        Left - the left hand input
        LeftOffset - the offset in this input
        Right - the right hand input
        RightOffset - the offset in this input
        BytesToHandle - the number of bytes to check for equality
        Returns:
        true, if the blocks are equal, false otherwise

                     int BlocksizeInByte)
        Enlarges the Input to multiple of blocksize
        Parameters:
        Input - the input byte array
        BlocksizeInByte - the block size in bytes
        Returns:
        the new, longer array

                     int BlocksizeInBytes)

        BlocksizeInBytes - the block size in bytes
        Returns:

      • resizeArrayToSize

        public byte[] resizeArrayToSize(byte[] Input,
                       int Size)
        Resizes the input array to the given size, without any respect of the content.
        Parameters:
        Input - the input byte array
        Size - the number of bytes the new array should hold
        Returns:
        the resized output array containing the bytes of the input array

      • resizeKey

        public static byte[] resizeKey(byte[] Key,
               int Size,
               int Blocksize)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Resizes the Key to new Size
        Parameters:
        Key - the old key
        Size - the new Size in bit
        Blocksize - the Blocksize in bit
        Returns:
        new Key with given size
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if size does not fit in blocks

      • resizeArray

        public static byte[] resizeArray(byte[] input)
        Cuts all null bytes following the last byte != 0.
        Parameters:
        input - the byte array to resize
        Returns:
        the resized array

      • generateIV

        public static byte[] generateIV(int length,
                int number_of_zero_bits)
        Generates an up to 64 Bits long IV. This IV is probably random, with maximum number of zero bits.
        Parameters:
        length - the length the IV should have, up to 8 Bytes
        number_of_zero_bits - the maximum number of zero bits in one flow in IV
        Returns:
        the IV

      • generateIV

        public static byte[] generateIV(int length)
        Generates an up to 64 Bits long IV. This IV is probably random.
        Parameters:
        length - the length the IV should have, up to 8 Bytes
        Returns:
        the IV

      • countNumberOfZeroBitsInFlow

        public static int countNumberOfZeroBitsInFlow(byte[] input)
        Counts the number of zero bit in one flow. It needs at least one zero byte to start counting.
        Parameters:
        input - the IV
        Returns:
        the Number of zero bits
